seint Iames 14
SEint Ieme&slong; þe holi Apo&slong;tle &punctelev; guod is to habbe in mone Iacob
Seint Iohane&slong; broþur þe Ewangeli&slong;t &punctelev; and o&rrot;e louerde&slong; aunte &slong;one
his Moder moder was o&rrot;e leuedi &slong;o&slong;ter &punctelev; Marie cleophe
Of guode kunne he wa&slong; icome &punctelev; non betere ne miȝhte be
he auȝhte wel him&slong;elf beo guod &punctelev; a&slong;e ȝe mowe alle ise
In þe londe of Samarie he p&rrot;echede &punctelev; and al&slong;o in Ivde
Þo&rrot;uȝ is p&rrot;echingue mani on &punctelev; he turnde to c&combtildevert;&slong;tindom Cristindom
To
hermogenes Hermogenes þe luþere p&rrot;ince &punctelev; þe tiþingue &slong;one com
¶Þilke p&rrot;ince was wichche &slong;trong &punctelev; and enchauntour al&slong;o
Þo&rrot;uȝ þe deuel he wolde al da&ydot; &punctelev; gret Miracle miracle do
Ane de&slong;ciple he hadde of is Art art &punctelev; philet Philet wa&slong; is name
heim he &slong;ende to &slong;eint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; to fondi to don him &slong;chame
Ȝif þat he miȝhte with is Art art &punctelev; seint Ieme ouercome
Togadere hu&ydot; comen fo&rrot;to pla&ydot;di &punctelev; a&slong;e þe da&ydot; was inome
Gode&slong; de&slong;ciple and þe feonde&slong; &punctelev; bigonne to pla&ydot;di fa&slong;te
Ac &slong;eint Seint
Ieme þat wa&slong; gode&slong; Godes de&slong;ciple &punctelev; aboue wa&slong; atþe la&slong;te
Blinde men he ȝaf heo&rrot;e &slong;ijȝht &punctelev; and maude hole in þe place
Me&slong;eles and þe crokede al&slong;o &punctelev; al þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerde&slong; grace
¶ Þo philet Philet i&slong;aiȝ him þus ouercome &punctelev; to is mai&slong;ter he wende &slong;one
Hermogene&slong; and tolde him fo&rrot;e &punctelev; a&slong;e is riȝhte wa&slong; to done
Sire he &slong;eide ne hope þov nouȝt &punctelev; to come &slong;eint Seint
Ieme
withInne withinne
Fo&rrot; nauȝt it is fo&rrot; þov ne &slong;chalt nouȝt &punctelev; ouercome him with al þi ginne
Þarefo&rrot;e do a&slong;e ichulle þe rede &punctelev; and go we to him we tweiȝe
And crie him merci and bicome we &punctelev; his de&slong;ciple&slong; be&ydot;e
Fo&rrot; &slong;iker þou beo ichulle it do &punctelev; þei þou nelle nouȝt al&slong;o
So wroth wa&slong; þe p&rrot;ince·þat he nu&slong;te &punctelev; ȝwat fo&rrot; w&rrot;athþe do The last eleven lines of the page show some water staining; however, all of the text is readable.
14· seint Iames
Þo&rrot;uȝ &slong;trencþe of þe deuele&slong; Art art &punctelev; he made philet Philet anon
Þat he ne miȝhte non mo&rrot;e þane a &slong;tok &punctelev; a fot of þat &slong;tude gon
¶ Nov he &slong;eide we &slong;chullen i&slong;eo &punctelev; ȝwat Ieme&slong; þe mai don here
Ȝweþer he þe mai aȝein me vndo &punctelev; and aȝein mine gode&slong; pouwere
he liet him ligge þare a&slong;e a &slong;tok &punctelev; and fo&rrot;th awei fram him wende
Philet nam ane man anon &punctelev; and &slong;eint Seint
Ieme wo&rrot;d &slong;ende
hou fa&slong;te þo&rrot;u þe deuele&slong; miȝhte &punctelev; he lai þer ibounde
And bad him helpe his de&slong;ciple &punctelev; and b&rrot;ingue þene deuel to grounde
¶ Seint Ieme him &slong;ende a lu&ydot;te cloth &punctelev; þat he with ⁁·him·
⁁ ber
Þat he touchede him þarewith &punctelev; and &slong;eide þeos two vers of þe &slong;auter
Ore louerd vnbind þat beoth ibounde &punctelev; and ȝif þe blinde is &slong;iȝhte
Ore louerd riȝtht heom þat buth vnriȝht &punctelev; fo&rrot; þou loue&slong;t alle riȝhte
¶ Þo philet Philet hadde þis ido &punctelev; a&slong;e &slong;eint Seint
Ieme wo&rrot;d him &slong;ende
Onbounde he wa&slong; of þe deuele&slong; bende&slong; &punctelev; and ȝwodere he wolde he wende
he þ&rrot;ettnede fa&slong;te hermogene&slong; Hermogenes &punctelev; to &slong;eint Seint
Ieme &slong;one he cam
And gode&slong; Godes de&slong;ciple wa&slong; and is &punctelev; and aveng c&combtildevert;&slong;tindom Cristindom
Þo
hermogene&slong; Hermogenes iherde þis &punctelev; þat he wa&slong; &slong;o vnbounde
And þat seint Seint
Ieme hadde ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; al is dede to grounde
¶Manie deuelene he conIurede coniurede &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; to him wende
Wel ȝe wutez he &slong;eide ȝwi it is &punctelev; þat ich after eov &slong;ende
Ore alre fo Ieme&slong; hath &punctelev; mine de&slong;ciple me binome
Bote ȝe beon &slong;trengo&rrot;e þane ich am &punctelev; iwis we beoth ouercome
Ich hote eov þat ȝe wenden anon &punctelev; and doth a god God p&rrot;eiȝe
Nimeth and b&rrot;inguet heom to me &punctelev; fa&slong;te ibounde beiȝe
Certe&slong; bote ȝe it mouwen do &punctelev; a&slong;e ȝe wel i&slong;eoth
Ouwer power ni&slong; nouȝt wurth an hawe &punctelev; fo&rrot; ouercome we beoth
¶We &slong;chulle &slong;one þe deuelene &slong;eiden &punctelev; with heom on v&rrot;þe pleiȝe
Fa&slong;te ibounde al to þine wille &punctelev; we &slong;chulle heom b&rrot;ingue be&ydot;ȝe
hu&ydot; comen fleo oppe in þe loft &punctelev; ouer þe apo&slong;tle seint Seint
Ieme
And anon &slong;o hu&ydot; weren ouer him icome &punctelev; hu&ydot; guonne to grenne and reme
Belewi and wel foule crie &punctelev; Iemes Ieme&slong; þin o&rrot;e
We b&rrot;ennez here are it o&rrot;e t&ydot;me be &punctelev; and beth ito&rrot;mented ful &slong;o&rrot;e
Ho to&rrot;mentede eov quath &slong;eint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; and ȝwat wolde ȝe nouþe here
Bote we buth icome þe feonde&slong; &slong;eiden &punctelev; to nime þe and þi fere
Hermogene&slong; u&slong; made hidere wiende &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ is conIuringue coniuringue
Þat we eov &slong;cholden fa&slong;te ibounde &punctelev; beiȝe to him b&rrot;ingue
Bote anon &slong;o we comen here ouer þe &punctelev; Aungle&slong; aungles to us come
With b&rrot;enninde raketeiȝene &punctelev; and fa&slong;te vsi bounde vs bounde and nome
here hu&ydot; u&slong; beteth and to&rrot;mentieth &punctelev; with b&rrot;enninde fu&ydot;&rrot;e
A we&ydot; wei Ieme&slong; ȝwat &slong;chulle we do &punctelev; we ne mowen nouȝt þis du&ydot;&rrot;e
A Ieme&slong; Ieme&slong; leoue louerd &punctelev; of u&slong; w&rrot;echche&slong; haue reuþe
And neuereft we nelleth neiȝ þe come &punctelev; pliȝhte we wolleth o&rrot;e treouþe
¶Ȝe wrechche fole&slong; quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; I not ȝwat ȝe wolden here
Of þat ȝe þouȝten me anu&ydot;e &punctelev; d&rrot;awe ȝe &slong;chullen arere
Al onbounde ich ȝ&ydot;ue eov leue &punctelev; aȝein fo&rrot;to fleo
&midddot;14· Iames 35
And b&rrot;inguth him þat hidere eov &slong;ende &punctelev; fa&slong;te ibounde to me
Þat ȝe ne don him non oþur harm &punctelev; fo&rrot; icholde with him &slong;peke
Wel is u&slong; nouþe þe sch&rrot;ewen &slong;eide &punctelev; we wo&rrot;þet wel aw&rrot;eke
¶To hermogene&slong; Hermogenes hu&ydot; comen &slong;one &punctelev; and to grounde him ca&slong;te
hu&ydot; d&rrot;owen him and is hondene bounden &punctelev; bihinden him wel fa&slong;te
Þus hu&ydot; &slong;eiden þou &slong;nde&slong;t us &punctelev; þare we gret wo ifielde
In gret to&rrot;ment and b&rrot;enningue &punctelev; and nouþe we wollez þe ȝelde
hu&ydot; harleden fo&rrot;th þu&slong;ne w&rrot;echche &punctelev; and to &slong;eint Seint
Ieme heo him b&rrot;ouȝte
And &slong;eiden lo &slong;ire ȝware he is her &punctelev; þat to &slong;wuche to&rrot;ment us w&rrot;ouȝte
Ȝif u&slong; fer&slong;t leue þat we moten &punctelev; o&rrot;e to&rrot;mens aw&rrot;eke
And þe muchele vnriȝht þat he u&slong; hath ido &punctelev; are þou with him &slong;peke
¶Na&ydot; certe&slong; quath þis holie man &punctelev; ȝe ne &slong;chullen nouȝt so
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd us hiet þat we &slong;cholden &punctelev; guod fo&rrot; vuele do
Ȝw&ydot; ne come [ȝe] nouȝt neiȝ philet Philet &punctelev; þat &slong;tant here bi me
Wel þou wo&slong;t þis oþure &slong;eiden &punctelev; þat we ne moten fo&rrot; þe
No goth þanne quath &slong;eint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; to eower ku&ydot;nde &slong;tude
And ne cometh neuereft neiȝ no guod man &punctelev; þei a fol eov habbe ibede
¶Euere &slong;tod hermogene&slong; Hermogenes &punctelev; and criede milce and o&rrot;e
he quakede fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede and fo&rrot; pine &punctelev; And and wep &slong;wiþe &slong;o&rrot;e
¶Philete
philete Philete quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; þes hath þe &slong;chame ido
Þov &slong;chalt don him guod aȝein vuel &punctelev; fo&rrot; mi louerd het me &slong;o
he bond þe þo þov were vnbounde &punctelev; fo&rrot; so mi louerd sede
Þov &slong;achalt vnbinde him þat is vnbounde &punctelev; and aȝein þulke luþere dede
Philet vnbond þane wrechche &punctelev; and dude him vuel fo&rrot; guod
Þe w&rrot;echche ne do&rrot;&slong;te nouȝwoder gon fo&rrot; fere &punctelev; ake quak&ydot;inde þare he &slong;tod
Go ȝware þov wolt quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; fo&rrot; mi louerd nele it nouȝt
Þat euere ani man aȝein is wille &punctelev; to him beo ib&rrot;ouȝt
¶A merci quath hermogenes Hermogenes &punctelev; þis deuelen me beteh beten &slong;o &slong;o&rrot;e
Þat I ne dar anne fot fram þe go &punctelev; la&slong;te hu&ydot; me nimen mo&rrot;e
hu&ydot; me wullez asle ȝif hu&ydot; me afongueth eft &punctelev; and þarefo&rrot;e ich bidde þe
Þat þov me take sum þing þat ich mouwe &punctelev; fo&rrot; heom bere with me
Seint Ieme him tok is &slong;taf on honde &punctelev; go nov fo&rrot;th he &slong;eide
Þere ni&slong; no deuel þat do&rrot;re nouþe &punctelev; neiȝ þe come fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede
Hermogene&slong; wende him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; his boke&slong; alle he nam
Þat he hadde of his enchauntemenz &punctelev; to þe Apo&slong;tle aȝein he cam
And bad þat he a&slong; fo&rrot;b&rrot;enne &slong;cholde &punctelev; þe Apo&slong;tle &slong;one heom nam
And ca&slong;te heom in þe deope·se &punctelev; fa&slong;te ibounde echon
¶Hermogene&slong; criede him merci &punctelev; and wilnede cri&slong;tindom
So þat he icri&slong;tned was &punctelev; and &slong;wiþe holi man bicam
Abiatar þat þo wa&slong; &punctelev; Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise luþur inovȝ
Fo&rrot; þis dede he wa&slong; wraoth &punctelev; toward &slong;eint Seint
Ieme with gret wouȝ
he nam him fa&slong;te and swo&rrot; is othþ &punctelev; þat he it &slong;cholde abugge deo&rrot;e
to þe k&ydot;ingue heroude&slong; Heroudes he liet him lede &punctelev; a rop aboute is &slong;were
Heroudes ȝaf his dom anon &punctelev; his þ&rrot;rote to &slong;mite atwo
And Io&slong;ie þe quellare he was bitake &punctelev; þulke dede fo&rrot;to do
14
Ane Rop rop he dude aboute is necke &punctelev; and ladde him toward is dome
Ane Man man he helde of þe pala&slong;ie &punctelev; are heo þudere come
Þo Io&slong;ie þis i&slong;aiȝ &punctelev; merci anon he criede
Seint Ieme þe holie Apo&slong;tle &punctelev; he bad wel &slong;one abide
And c&combtildevert;&slong;tni cristni him in þe place &punctelev; anonriȝte&slong; þere
A&slong;einte marie Marie da&ydot; in leinte Leinte &punctelev; bihaueded boþe heo were
Ake holie curche churche halt of o&rrot;e leuedi &punctelev; fe&slong;te þat ilke da&ydot;
Bifo&rrot;e lama&slong;&slong;e Lamasse seueniȝht &punctelev; we holdeth is da&ydot; bifo&rrot;e þerfo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; þulke da&ydot;e is bodi wa&slong; &punctelev; into &slong;ch&rrot;ine ibo&rrot;e
¶Anon &slong;o seint Seint
Ieme þe holie man &punctelev; bihaueded was þere
his de&slong;ciples him wolden lede awei &punctelev; ac hu&ydot; ne do&rrot;&slong;ten fo&rrot; fere
heo&rrot;e t&ydot;me hu&ydot; awa&ydot;teden wel &punctelev; ȝwanne none Men men þare neiȝ nere
And þat bodi wel &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; out of þe countre&ydot;e bere
In a schip hu&ydot; leiden it in þe se &punctelev; and fo&rrot;th þarewithþ hu&ydot; wende
And none ȝeme ne nomen ȝwoderward fare &punctelev; bote a&slong;e god God he[m] kende
Þat schip wende fo&rrot;th bi him&slong;eolf &punctelev; and hit cam on a da&ydot;
Into þe lond of Galeis &punctelev; þare a&slong;e þe quene la&ydot;
Þat luþur
was and sch&rrot;ewe inovȝ &punctelev; &slong;eint Iemes
Men men anon
Op of þe schipe nomen þat holie bodi &punctelev; and leiden it opon a &slong;ton
Þe &slong;ton bigan to wexe ab&rrot;od &punctelev; and holuȝ bicam amidde
A&slong;e euene imaud to þe holie bodi &punctelev; as ani man wolde bidde
¶e scholde no man so euene a þ&rrot;ovȝ &punctelev; Nin lengþe and i in b&rrot;ede
To him a&slong;e þat &slong;ton bicam &punctelev; a&slong;e ech man þat it i&slong;aiȝ &slong;eide
his de&slong;ciples a&slong;e it was riȝht &punctelev; to þe Quene quene ere&slong;t wende
Dame hu&ydot; &slong;eiden we habbeth ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd þe hider &slong;ende
Seint Ieme&slong; bodi his Apo&slong;tle &punctelev; of ȝwam þov nome ofte þi red
To laten him nime þe ȝw&ydot;le he wa&slong; quik &punctelev; a&slong;e mani men it habbeth i&slong;eid
Ore louerd him hath hidere i&slong;ent &punctelev; a&slong;e he him&slong;eolf baed
Loke ȝware þov him legge wolt &punctelev; fo&rrot; icome he is to þe ded
¶E&ydot; tra&ydot;tour&slong; quath þe luþere Quen quen &punctelev; ȝweþer ȝe beon of his
Ȝwane i I ne miȝhte of him beo awreke &punctelev; of eov ichulle iwis
Þis guode Men men he nam echone &punctelev; and to þe king of &slong;pa&ydot;gne Spaygne heom &slong;ende
Þat he heom b&rrot;ouȝte to &slong;trong dethþe &punctelev; oþur don heom heo&rrot;e lawe wende
Echone þe king nam anon &punctelev; and in &slong;trongue p&rrot;i&slong;one heom b&rrot;ouȝte
Ac o&rrot;e louerd ne fo&rrot;ȝat heom nouȝt &punctelev; ake wel &slong;one on heom þouȝte
Fo&rrot; an Aungel aungel fram heouene cam &punctelev; and þat p&rrot;i&slong;oun b&rrot;ak wel sone
Þo þe k&ydot;ng wa&slong; þarof iwar &punctelev; he nu&slong;te ȝwat wa&slong; to done
¶
Kn&ydot;ȝhte&slong; knyȝhtes he liet &slong;iende inowe &punctelev; aftur heom wel wide
Þat febleliche agonne in heo&rrot;e neode&slong; &punctelev; fo&rrot; &slong;chame heom gan bitide
Fo&rrot; a&slong;e hu&ydot; wolden ouer ane heiȝe b&rrot;ugge &punctelev; after þis guode men gon
Vnder heom þe b&rrot;ugge b&rrot;ak &punctelev; and hu&ydot; ad&rrot;ounken echon
¶Þo þe t&ydot;þingue to þe kingue cam &punctelev; &slong;o&rrot;i he wa&slong; inovȝ
Of is luþere
þouȝt þat he þouȝte &punctelev; fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede he him withd&rrot;ovȝ
Mildeliche he to heom he &slong;ende &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; aȝein comen him to
And þat he heom wolde amendi faire &punctelev; of al þat he hadde heom mi&slong;do
14 Iames 36
Aȝein hu&ydot; wenden to þe k&ydot;ng &punctelev; and he faire aȝein heom cam
Ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ he and al is Men men &punctelev; afenguen cri&slong;tinedom
¶Þe king &slong;ende þe Quene quene wo&rrot;d &punctelev; þat heo &slong;cholde heo&rrot;e wille al do
Ful &slong;o&rrot;i wa&slong; þe Quene quene þo &punctelev; and &slong;o&rrot;e anu&ydot;d al&slong;o
Ake heo ne do&rrot;&slong;te nouȝt beo aȝein is he&slong;te &punctelev; nere hire no &slong;o
wo
Wilde bollokes heo wu&slong;te fale &punctelev; ope ane heiȝe hulle go
Gothþ heo &slong;eide ope þulke hulle &punctelev; finde ȝe mowen þere
Oxene and Bolen bolen &slong;trongue inovȝ &punctelev; fo&rrot;te leden with ouwer bere
Teiȝeth heom to þulke wa&ydot;ne &punctelev; and þat bodi leggez þarinne
And ledeth it ȝware eouwere wille beo &punctelev; gode&slong; Godes leue ȝe habbe and minne
¶Fo&rrot; þe Bolloke&slong; bollokes wilde were &punctelev; þe luþere Quene quene &slong;o &slong;eide
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; ne &slong;cholden heom temie nouȝt &punctelev; eniþing fo&rrot;to lede
his de&slong;ciples wenden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; to þulke hulle heiȝe
A fu&ydot;&rrot; D&rrot;ake drake þaropon &punctelev; aȝein heom cominde hu&ydot; &slong;eiȝe
Swiþe ferliche he bla&slong;te fu&ydot;&rrot; &punctelev; and asa&ydot;llede heom fa&slong;te
Mani a man he hadde aslawe &punctelev; and al þe contreie of him aga&slong;te
¶Þis de&slong;ciples mauden þe &slong;igne &slong;one &punctelev; of þe Creo&ydot;z heom bifo&rrot;e
Anon hadde þis luþere wo&rrot;m &punctelev; is pouwer al ilo&rrot;e
Þat hit ne miȝhte ane fot fo&rrot;þere pa&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; þis de&slong;ciple&slong; fo&rrot;th wende
And topouneden it al to deþe &punctelev; and ech lime fram oþur rende
Þe Bolloke&slong; bollokes and þe ȝoungue &slong;teo&rrot;e&slong; &punctelev; þat weren er &slong;o wilde
Anon &slong;o hu&ydot; touward ⁁heom come &punctelev; hu&ydot; woxen tame and milde
Þe be&slong;te hu&ydot; chosen þat hu&ydot; wolden &punctelev; and to þe wa&ydot;ne heom ladde
And hu&ydot; d&rrot;owen þat bodi so mildeliche &punctelev; þat ech man þarof wonder hadde
¶Þis de&slong;ciple&slong; nomen &slong;eint Seint
Ieme&slong; bodi &punctelev; and opon þe wa&ydot;ne it leide
Þe be&slong;tes it d&rrot;owen fo&rrot;th wel mildeliche &punctelev; withoute eche fole b&rrot;eide
hu&ydot; comen and d&rrot;iue þane wa&ydot;n &punctelev; þare a&slong; þe Quene quene wa&slong;
hire wond&rrot;ede muche and d&rrot;adde &slong;o&rrot;e &punctelev; þo heo i&slong;eiȝ þat cas
¶Heo fo&rrot;&slong;ok hire fal&slong;e bileue &punctelev; and tok hire to cri&slong;tindom
Fo&rrot; þe wonder þat heo i&slong;eiȝ &punctelev; and guod womman bicom
Al hure pale&ydot;s þat heo wa&slong; inne &punctelev; and al heo&rrot;e oþure bone
Fo&rrot;to honouri þat holie bodi &punctelev; heo grauntede heom wel &slong;one
Amidde þe pale&ydot;&slong; þis holi bodi &punctelev; hu&ydot; bureden with grete p&rrot;u&ydot;te
Þare he hath euereft to þis dai ibeo &punctelev; and &slong;o he is ȝu&ydot;te
¶Heo liet arere ane noble churche &punctelev; and gret tre&slong;o&rrot; he ȝaf þarto
And gret lond þat ȝu&ydot;t þareto lijth &punctelev; and grete rente&slong; al&slong;o
Ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ of religioun &punctelev; a gret hous nouþe þare is
Of Chanone&slong; chanones þat Men men ȝeot i&slong;eoth and &slong;echethþ &punctelev; at &slong;eint Seint
Ieme&slong; of Gal&ydot;s
A gret pileg&combtildevert;mage pilegrimage it is iholde &punctelev; oueral a&slong;e iȝe iseothþ
To &slong;echen þat ilke holie &slong;tude &punctelev; þare &slong;eint Seint
Ieme&slong; bone&slong; beothþ
Mani miracle is pileg&combtildevert;mes pilegrime&slong; &slong;eggeth &punctelev; þat þare hath ofte icome
Þei we ne mouwen nouȝt alle telle &punctelev; þenche we moten on &slong;ome
¶Þ&rrot;itti Men men at one t&ydot;me &punctelev; pileg&combtildevert;mes pilegrime&slong; bicome
To &slong;eint Seint
Ieme&slong; þe holie &slong;tude &punctelev; alle þene wei hu&ydot; nome
A&slong;e hu&ydot; wenden bi þe weiȝe &punctelev; &slong;o gret loue hu&ydot; hadden and trewe
14· Iames 14 37
And so guod heo&rrot;te ech to oþur hadde &punctelev; þat a fo&rrot;eward hu&ydot; mauden newe
Þat non ne scholde failli oþur &punctelev; in perile ne in neode
Ake wedb&rrot;eþerne hu&ydot; bicomen echon &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; þat wei eode
heo&rrot;e treuþes hu&ydot; pliȝhten alle bote on &punctelev; ake he nolde his nouȝt pliȝte
Ake þat fo&rrot;eward he bihet to holde &punctelev; treuweliche ope al is miȝhte
¶So þat it bifeol bi þe weie &punctelev; þat on ivuelede a da&ydot;
And vnder þe hulle of seint Seint
Miȝhel &punctelev; longue sijk he la&ydot;
his felawes þat hadde him treouþe ipliȝht &punctelev; fiftene dawes þere
Abiden him; so þat heom þouȝte longue &punctelev; fo&rrot; so&rrot;e anu&ydot;de hu&ydot; were
And seiden we ne mouwen no leng abide &punctelev; late we him ligge[ligge on the margin.] &slong;tille
Do we moten o&rrot;e pilegrimage &punctelev; god do bi him is wille
hu&ydot; nomen heo&rrot;e leue and lieten him ligge &punctelev; and wenden fo&rrot;th echon
Bote þilke þat nolde is treuþe pliȝhte &punctelev; he nolde nouȝt fram him gon
¶Certes he seide god God do is wille &punctelev; and lieue eov wel to wende
I nelle anne fot fram him gon &punctelev; are ich wute of him sum ende
Mid him he bilefde al one &punctelev; fo&rrot;to þat he ded were
Betere is trewe dede þane fals wo&rrot;d &punctelev; as it was isene þere
Þis trewe Man man þat was with þe bodi &punctelev; ful so&rrot;e ad&rrot;ad he was
Fo&rrot; he was so feo&rrot; fram toune &punctelev; and no man neiȝh him nas
Fo&rrot; he was with þe dede al one &punctelev; and it was neiȝh niȝhte
he nu&slong;te ȝwat with þat bodi to do &punctelev; bote seint Seint
Ieme him helpe miȝhte
his help he bad with guode heo&rrot;te. &punctelev; and in þe eueningue riȝht
Seint Ieme cam to him ride &punctelev; in wel fair at&ydot;r of kniȝht
¶Cum here he seide fo&rrot;th with me &punctelev; ne haue þou of noþing d&rrot;ede
Bifo&rrot;e me ca&slong;t þat bodi her &punctelev; and ich it wolle hennes lede
And lupe þou up bih&ydot;nde me. &punctelev; and þo þis was al ido
Þis holie Man man ladde þene dede fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and þene quike also
F&ydot;ftene Io&rrot;neies iorneies grete are da&ydot; &punctelev; in þulke lu&ydot;tele ȝwile
To þe mount of Ioie &punctelev; þat is bisides seint Seint
Iemes a mile
Þo hu&ydot; comen to þulke Mount mount &punctelev; seint Ieme gan abide
Go he seide to þe quike manne &punctelev; to mine churche herebiside
And seiȝe mine Canones canones þat þarinne beoth &punctelev; þat ich heom wo&rrot;d bi þe sende
Mine pilegrim þat me was leof &punctelev; þat in treowenesse mine wei wende
Þat hu&ydot; him burien among heom þere &punctelev; with fair seruise and liȝhte
Fo&rrot; ded he schal þudere come &punctelev; ȝwane he aliue ne miȝhte
And seie heom þat þine felawes were &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e wei is al ilo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e treouþe þat hu&ydot; b&rrot;eke &punctelev; heo&rrot;e felawe þat is nov bifo&rrot;e
And þine ȝw&ydot;le ichulle þe ȝelde &punctelev; þat þou ha&slong;t þus treowe ibeo.
Mid þusse wo&rrot;de he wende fo&rrot;th &punctelev; þat he ne miȝhte him nonemo&rrot;e ise
¶Aboute þat bodi fo&rrot; þis Miracle miracle &punctelev; folk cam þicke reke
Here man mai sumdel iseo &punctelev; ȝwuch [it is] treouþe to b&rrot;eke
And ȝwuch it is þane holie we&ydot; &punctelev; to seint Seint
Iemes fo&rrot;to go
Þis Miracle miracle is so Murie murie &punctelev; ich mot ȝeot telle of mo
¶Hit was a guod man and is sone &punctelev; þat toward seint Seint
Iemes wende
To þe cite of Tolouse &punctelev; aȝein eue hu&ydot; hem kende
Al niȝht hu&ydot; bilefden þere &punctelev; at ane luþere manne&slong; Inne inne
he þouȝte with ȝwuche t&combtildevert;cherie tricherie &punctelev; he miȝhte panewe&slong; winne
¶Nou wa&slong; þe lawe in þulke &slong;tude &punctelev; a&slong; þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe wel onder&slong;tod
Þat ho&slong;o anhengue anine anne man &punctelev; he scholde habbe al is guodHorstmann corrects "anine" to "anne", but "ani" is another possibility. It seems likely that the latter was what the scribe first intended. If he intended to correct the word to "anne", he left no deletion mark for the "i".
Þe sch&rrot;ewe heom made fair &slong;emblaunt &punctelev; a&slong;e is manere wa&slong; to done
Þat hu&ydot; were fo&rrot;d&rrot;onke beie &punctelev; and a&slong;lepe leiȝen &slong;one
A coppe of seluer &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; þis luþere Man man gan b&rrot;ingue
And dude in heo&rrot;e schrippe &slong;ofteliche &punctelev; among heo&rrot;e oþur þingue
¶Þis guode Man man awok and is &slong;one &punctelev; &slong;o &slong;one &slong;o it ⧶⧶wa&slong; ⧶dai⧶
And nomen heo&rrot;e leue and wenden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and nu&slong;ten nouȝt of þat cas
Þo hu&ydot; come withoute toune a lu&ydot;te &punctelev; þi&slong; luþere man aftur cam
hotinde out with grete &slong;iwte &punctelev; and þis trewe men beie he nam
And &slong;eide hu&ydot; hadden is coppe i&slong;tole &punctelev; and in heo&rrot;e &slong;crippe ibounde
Þat folk þis iliefde anon &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; þe coppe founde
¶Þis pilegrime&slong; þei hu&ydot; treowe weren &punctelev; to dome weren ib&rrot;ouȝt
Eche manere þeofþe hu&ydot; fur&slong;oken &punctelev; ake þat folk ne liefde heom nouȝt
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; weren inome hond habbinde &punctelev; þe court lokede anon
Þat hu&ydot; heo&rrot;e dom with heom beren &punctelev; and hangu&ydot; &slong;cholde þat on
¶Alas alas þe fader &slong;eide &punctelev; ȝweþur i &slong;chulle novþe hongue
And are ich habbe &slong;eint Seint
Ieme i&slong;ouȝt &punctelev; þi&slong; file dethþ afongue
Nai certe&slong; quath is &slong;one &punctelev; þat nolde ich graunti þe
Fo&rrot; to beo louerd of al þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; þat þov deide&slong;t bifo&rrot;e me
hangu&ydot; ichulle fo&rrot; u&slong; boþe &punctelev; þene deth inelle nouȝt fo&rrot;&slong;ake
And al&slong;o wi&slong; a&slong;e we gultle&slong;e beoth &punctelev; mine &slong;oule ich god God bitake
A mi leoue &slong;one quath þe fader &punctelev; so ne &slong;chal it nouȝt beo
Scholde&slong;t þou deiȝe and ich libbe &punctelev; inelle neuere þane da&ydot; i&slong;eo
Swuch a child touward a&slong; þou art &punctelev; iloked it were w&rrot;oþe
Þat þov &slong;cholde&slong;t hangu&ydot; and ich libbe &punctelev; ichulle hang&ydot; fo&rrot; us boþe
A fader fader quath þe &slong;one &punctelev; be &slong;tille ich bidde þe
Fo&rrot; I nelle neuere þane da&ydot; abide &punctelev; þat þou &slong;chulle hongue bifo&rrot;e me
¶Ake go þane we&ydot; fo&rrot; us boþe &punctelev; and ichulle hang&ydot; fo&rrot; us be&ydot;e
And bide &slong;eint Seint
Ieme þat he me graunti &punctelev; &slong;um part of þine we&ydot;e
Bitwene þe fader and þe sone &punctelev; þe &slong;triuingue la&slong;te longue
Þat ech man hadde deol þerof &punctelev; ȝweþur scholde þene dethþ afongue
So þat it ful atþenende &punctelev; þei it were with w&rrot;ongue
Þat þe &slong;one fo&rrot; heom beiȝe &punctelev; gulteles wa&slong; anhongue
¶Alas·alas·þe deolfole cas &punctelev; to heo&rrot;e &slong;o muche fal&slong;hede
Wel ȝeo&rrot;ne boþe fader and &slong;one &punctelev; seint Seint
Ieme help hu&ydot; bede
Welle louerd þe deol of þe fader &punctelev; gretto&rrot;e neuere non nas
Þo he i&slong;aiȝ is &slong;one anhongue &punctelev; and fo&rrot; he gultele&slong; was
he bite&ydot;ȝte is &slong;oule Ie&slong;u cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þo þare na&slong; non oþur won
And is wei with &slong;o&rrot;ewe inov &punctelev; to &slong;eint Seint
Ieme&slong; he gan gon
Al&slong;o wel fo&rrot; is &slong;one a&slong;e fo&rrot; him &punctelev; &slong;eint Seint
Ieme he bad fa&slong;te
And wende þo he hadde al ido &punctelev; hamward at þe la&slong;te
Are he come þare is &slong;one was &punctelev; him þouȝte sw&ydot;þe longue

Ȝif he miȝhte finde oþur i&slong;eo &punctelev; ani lime of him hongue
Fo&rrot; þe lawe wa&slong; þere þat euerech man &punctelev; þat anhangued were
hangu&ydot; &slong;cholde þe ȝw&ydot;le ila&slong;te &punctelev; and fo&rrot;to ech lime fram oþur totere
¶Þis ȝoungue Man man sixe and þ&rrot;itti dawe&slong; &punctelev; heng upon þe galutreo
Are is fader aȝein to him come &punctelev; þat iroted he auȝte to beo
he cam and fond him ȝu&ydot;t &punctelev; and ner him he gan teo
he weop and criede and w&rrot;ong is hondene &punctelev; þat deol it wa&slong; to seo
¶Leoue fader þe sone &slong;eide &punctelev; ne weop þou nouȝt to bliue
Fo&rrot; ich nam to biweope nouȝt &punctelev; ȝeot ich am aliue
Me na&slong; neuere on eo&rrot;þe &slong;o wel &punctelev; a&slong;e me hath &slong;ethþe ibeo
Ich am a&slong;e þei ich were in heouene &punctelev; þei ich hangu&ydot; here on þis treo
Fo&rrot; seint Seint
Ieme me halt up &punctelev; and Io&ydot;e ioye inovȝ me dieth make
Me ofþuncheth þat þou &slong;o &slong;one come &punctelev; la&slong;te þov me adoun take
Louerd þe Io&ydot;e ioye þat þe fader &punctelev; hadde þulke &slong;tounde
Þo he aftur al is so&rrot; &punctelev; his &slong;one aliue founde
¶To toune he o&rrot;n with Io&ydot;e ioye inouȝ &punctelev; and cleopede folk wel fa&slong;te
Muche folk him &slong;iwede and al þe &slong;oþe &punctelev; i&slong;eiȝen atþe la&slong;te
Withþ gret Io&ydot;e ioye hu&ydot; nomen him adoun &punctelev; and to þe toune him b&rrot;ouȝten
Þene traitur þat him maude anhongue &punctelev; wel &slong;one out hu&ydot; &slong;ouȝten
And anhenguen him wel heiȝe anon &punctelev; and nouȝt bote he wu&ydot;&rrot;þe were
Þus &slong;eint Seint
Ieme þe holie man &punctelev; is pilegrim halp þere
¶In þe Cite cite of leouns Leouns &punctelev; a ȝoung man þare wa&slong; al&slong;o
Þat ofte wende to &slong;eint Seint
Iemes &punctelev; and gret loue hadde þarto
At one t&ydot;me a&slong;e he þudere wolde &punctelev; he dude er ane folie
Þat manie Men men to helle b&rrot;ingueth &punctelev; þe &slong;unne of lecherie
Toward &slong;eint Seint
Ieme&slong; he wende fo&rrot;thþ &punctelev; are he i&slong;ch&rrot;iue were
Þe deuel wa&slong; wel ȝeo&rrot;ne aboute &punctelev; ȝif he miȝhte him mi&slong;lere
¶Aȝein him he cam in þe wei &punctelev; &slong;wiþe milde and &slong;ofte
Riȝht a&slong;e it &slong;eint Seint
Ieme were &punctelev; a&slong;e þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe g&ydot;leth men wel ofte
Ȝwo&slong;t þou euere he &slong;eide ho ich am &punctelev; þe ȝoungue man &slong;eide na&ydot;
Icham þilke he &slong;eide þat þov ha&slong;t &punctelev; I&slong;erued iserued wel mani a da&ydot;
Seint Ieme toward ȝwam þou art &punctelev; I ne ma&ydot; make no mone
Of þe þat þov wel ne de&slong;t &punctelev; of eche þingue bote of one
Þat þou deu&slong;t lecherie &punctelev; are þou wende&slong;t to me
Among alle men ȝif þat nere &punctelev; me&slong;t ich p&rrot;ei&slong;ie þe
¶Seint Ieme merci quath þis man &punctelev; ich crie þe milce and o&rrot;e
Fo&rrot;ȝif me þulke luþere &slong;unne &punctelev; i nelle don a&slong; neuereft mo&rrot;e
Ov beau frere quath þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe &punctelev; &slong;trong is þe mi&slong;dede
Þov ne miȝht me neuere pa&ydot;e wel &punctelev; bote þov do a&slong;e ich rede
Þe menb&rrot;e þov mo&slong;t keruen of &punctelev; ȝwarewithþ þou i&slong;unegut|ha&slong;t·
Þe &slong;unne ichulle fo&rrot;ȝiue þe þanne &punctelev; ȝwanne he i&slong; fram þe ica&slong;t
Ak next me þou &slong;cholde&slong;t in Io&ydot;e ioye beo &punctelev; in þe bli&slong;&slong;e of heouene aboue
Ȝif þou wolde&slong;t beon a mart&ydot;&rrot; &punctelev; and þiseolf martri fo&rrot; mi loue
¶A louerd seint Seint
Ieme quath þis man &punctelev; þov haue merci of me
Ichulle mine &slong;unne&slong; to bete mi&slong;ulf martri &punctelev; and fo&rrot;to pa&ydot;ȝe þe

Þi&slong; wrechche Man man carf of i&slong; memb&rrot;e&slong; &punctelev; and awei fram him ca&slong;te
And &slong;ethþe þo&rrot;uȝ þe fal&slong;e þeue&slong; rede &punctelev; him&slong;elf he aslovȝ atþe la&slong;te
Ful redi wa&slong; þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe þer &punctelev; þe &slong;oule he nam anon
And wel glad þarewith in his manere &punctelev; toward helle he gan gon
Ne furȝat nouȝt &slong;eint Seint
Ieme is pileg&combtildevert;m pilegrim &punctelev; fo&rrot; þat cas þat him gan bitide
Aȝein þe deuel he cam adoun &punctelev; and bad þane &slong;ch&rrot;ewe abide
And &slong;eide þou ber&slong;t mo&rrot;e þane þin owe &punctelev; þat i &slong;chal ku&ydot;þe þe
Ȝwi ha&slong;t þou mine pileg&combtildevert;m pilegrim bitraid? &punctelev; gret schame þou de&slong;t me
Ȝe al fo&rrot; nauȝt quath þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe &punctelev; þou art hidere icome
In his &slong;unne him&slong;ulf he aslouȝ &punctelev; and þarewith ich him habbe inome
Ne ma&ydot; no man in dedlich &slong;unne &punctelev; into heuene wende
A&slong;e wel þou miȝht gon hom aȝein &punctelev; he is min withouten enden
¶Bel am&ydot; quath &slong;eint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; þou bitraide&slong;t him with fal&slong;hede
And with t&combtildevert;cherie tricherie þou to him come &punctelev; lat him gon ich rede
Ich habbe leue quath þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe &punctelev; to big&ydot;li and bitra&ydot;e ⁁also
Mid eche quointi&slong;e þat ich mai &punctelev; ȝwi wolde he aftur me do
Þis &slong;trif ila&slong;te bitwene hem longue &punctelev; ake þo &slong;eint Seint
Ieme ne miȝhte
habbe þe &slong;oule ne withinne him come &punctelev; with no re&slong;un ne riȝhte
Þou &slong;chalt he &slong;eide come with me &punctelev; to an herre Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise
Þat þe &slong;chal cu&ydot;þe þi tricherie &punctelev; of ȝwam þe schal ag&combtildevert;se agrise
Bifo&rrot;e o&rrot;e leuedi &slong;wete and milde &punctelev; þane &slong;ch&rrot;ewe he gan lede
he ȝal and quakede deolfulliche &punctelev; þo he i&slong;eiȝ hire fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede
¶Þov luþere þing o&rrot;e leuedi &slong;eide &punctelev; ȝwi fonde&slong;te in alle wi&slong;e
To binime u&slong; and bitraiȝe men &punctelev; þat beth in ovre &slong;erui&slong;e
Þou ne &slong;chalt neuere þe &slong;oule b&rrot;ouke &punctelev; fo&rrot; þine t&combtildevert;cherie tricherie
leoue leuedi quath þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe &punctelev; merci ich þe crie
Vnder&slong;tond þat ich habbe leue &punctelev; to big&ydot;lie men inouȝ
And þat ich fond him in dedlich &slong;unne &punctelev; and þareinne him&slong;ulf he &slong;lov
And no man neuere in &slong;wuch ca&slong; &punctelev; to heuene come ne miȝhte
A&slong;e he i&slong; min mid alle lawe &punctelev; hold me ich bidde to riȝhte
¶Þov luþere be&slong;t o&rrot;e leuedi &slong;eide &punctelev; to muche ower pouwer is
Ala&slong; þat men nellez beon iwar &punctelev; are hu&ydot; don amis
A&slong;e þou mid þine tricherie &punctelev; his lijf him binome
Al&slong;o ichulle him ȝiuen aȝein &punctelev; is lijf with riȝhte dome
So þat þe ne tit of him no part &punctelev; fo&rrot; guod man he wo wol ȝeot be
Ore leuedi made þe &slong;oule anono &punctelev; to þe bodi aȝen fleo
Fram deþe to liue he aros &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e leuedi o&rrot;e
And guod lijf ladde euere afturward &punctelev; and þe deuel doutede þe mo&rrot;e
¶His menb&rrot;e&slong; þat he carf of &punctelev; euereft he dude mi&slong;&slong;e
Bote a lu&ydot;tel wi&slong;e ȝware þo&rrot;uȝ he miȝhte &punctelev; ȝwane he wolde pi&slong;&slong;e
Manie Men men fo&rrot; þulke miracle &punctelev; &slong;eint Ieme louieth þe mo&rrot;e
Nou bidde we ȝeo&rrot;ne euerechone &punctelev; &slong;eint Seint
Ieme mil&slong;e and o&rrot;e
Þat he fo&rrot; þat holie &slong;tude &punctelev; þat he hath in galiz Galiz
helpe u&slong; and alle is pileg&combtildevert;me&slong; pilegrimes &punctelev; and b&rrot;ingue u&slong; to heouene blis The last ten lines of the page and, to a lesser extent, the first fifteen lines show considerable water staining.
